Biography

ABOUT ME

John D. Robinson, MD is the newest member of San Marcos Orthopedics.

John D. Robinson, MD is a fellowship trained Sports Medicine Orthopedic Surgeon specializing in advanced knee and shoulder arthroscopy as well as shoulder, robotic knee and anterior hip joint replacement. Completing his fellowship training with Tahoe Orthopedics and Mammoth Orthopedic Institute, he regularly treated complex mountain extremity injuries with an emphasis on the most innovative and minimally invasive techniques. His experience with cutting-edge procedures, such as ACL Repair, Bridge Enhanced ACL Restoration (BEAR), and shoulder arthroplasty using patient-specific computerized planning, provides a unique solution that preserves or restores native anatomy and function. In addition to managing sports medicine pathology and arthritis, Dr. Robinson routinely takes orthopedic surgery trauma call at several local hospitals and manages a variety of upper and lower extremity fractures throughout Hays and Comal counties.

He is currently involved with the US Men’s and Women’s Ski and Snowboard Teams and will be assisting Texas State University as a co-team Physician. By providing care to patients from all walks of life – from Olympic medalists to recreational athletes, he understands the importance of developing a treatment plan that is personalized for each patient’s unique goals.

Dr. Robinson is married to his wife, Macie, who is a Pediatric Nurse Practitioner in Lockhart. They live in San Marcos and are passionate about living in and serving the surrounding communities. He is an avid outdoorsman that enjoys fly-fishing, archery, elk/deer hunting, skiing/snowboarding, football, basketball, pickleball, and golf.

To schedule an appointment with Dr. Saini, call (512)878-4203 or CLICK HERE to submit an online appointment request. 

Clinical Interests
View Hide Interests
  • Arthroscopic shoulder surgery including rotator cuff repair
  • Arthroscopic knee surgery including ACL Reconstruction
  • ACL Repair using the BEAR implant
  • Treatment of ligament and tendon injuries of the shoulder, elbow, knee, and ankle
  • Arthritis treatment of the shoulder, hip, and knee
  • Robotic-assisted hip and knee replacements
  • Patient-specific shoulder replacement
  • Non-operative management using platelet-rich plasma (PRP), visco-supplementation, and steroid injections
  • Fracture care (upper and lower extremities)
Medical Training & Education
View Hide Education

Orthopedic Surgery Residency: John Peter Smith Health Network, Fort Worth, TX Sports Medicine Fellowship: Lake Tahoe Sports Medicine Fellowship, South Lake Tahoe, CA/NV Mammoth Orthopedic Institute, Mammoth Lakes, CA

Undergraduate: University of Arizona, Tucson, AZ Summa Cum Laude Medical: The University of Texas Medical Branch at Galveston, TX Alpha Omega Alpha Honors Medical Society
